intro: Centaurium confertum, commonly known as the clustered chickweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has slender, hairy stems. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early summer. Centaurium confertum is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
